420affc2-6283-4814-bae7-69ab1d231778:
A blast of furnace-hot wind blasts downward, inflicting {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}4d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} + 1 point per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} to all creatures in the area and knocking them prone. A successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} halves the fire {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} and negates being knocked prone.
Any creature that takes damage from a sirocco becomes fatigued (or exhausted, if already fatigued, such as from a previous {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} of exposure to a sirocco {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}). Creatures with the water subtype take a -4 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on all saving throws against this spell and take double normal damage.
4c5a0bd1-c80c-407b-9c37-8b912b91dfc4: A blast of hellfire blazes from your hands. You can fire one ray, plus one additional ray for every 4 caster levels beyond 11th (to a maximum of three rays at 19th level). Each ray requires a ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g} to hit and deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum 15d6). Half the damage is {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g}, but the other half results directly from unholy power and is therefore not subject to being reduced by fire resistance.
c65ae1c3-f3a2-47f4-a55b-f7c34b3c1336: A confused creature is mentally befuddled and cannot act normally.
a0257bb1-c228-48af-a5f3-bfce353f12f6:
A thin, green ray springs from your pointing finger.[LONGSTART] You must make a successful ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g} to hit.[LONGEND] Any creature struck by the ray takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (to a maximum of 40d6). Any creature reduced to 0 or fewer {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} by this {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} is entirely disintegrated, leaving behind only a trace of fine dust. A disintegrated creature's equipment is unaffected.[LONGSTART] The ray affects objects constructed entirely of force, such as forceful hand or a wall of force, but not magical effects such as a globe of invulnerability or an antimagic field.[LONGEND]
A creature or object that makes a successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} is partially affected, taking only 5d6 points of damage. If this damage reduces the creature or object to 0 or fewer hit points, it is entirely disintegrated.
Only the first creature or object struck can be affected; that is, the ray affects only one target per casting.
3c7c46b5-205d-497e-a5ea-41712d5b74b0: Acid fog creates a billowing mass of highly acidic, misty vapors that slow down creatures. Creatures moving through acid fog move at half their normal {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} and take a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} and melee {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}. The vapors prevent effective ranged weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}, granting all creatures inside the fog a +8 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} against normal {g|Encyclopedia:RangedAttack}ranged attacks{/g}. Each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} on your turn, starting when you cast the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, the fog deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}acid damage{/g} to each creature and object within it.
dda2b1e9-769d-45bb-beb1-c4e4c88ec996: An immobile, vertical curtain of whirling blades shaped of pure force springs into existence. Any creature passing through the wall takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum 15d6), with a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} for half damage.
50af5a18-85e8-488b-ace3-2f8cf6859f4a:
Any chaotic evil, chaotic good, lawful evil, or lawful good creatures within the area of this {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} suffer the following ill effects:
If the creature's HD is equal to your {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}, it is sickened.
If the creature's HD is up to your caster level – 1, it is staggered and sickened.
If the creature's HD is up to your caster level – 5, it is nauseated, staggered, and sickened.
If the creature's HD is up to your caster level – 10, it is killed, nauseated, staggered, and sickened.
The effects are cumulative and concurrent. A successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} reduces or eliminates these effects. Creatures affected by multiple effects make only one save and apply the result to all of the effects. Creatures whose {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Dice{/g} exceed your caster level are unaffected by arbitrament.
c477f856-de9a-4576-91b8-f418b80722c8:
Any nonchaotic creature within the area of a word of chaos {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} suffers the following ill effects:
If the creature's HD is up to your {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} – 1, it is stunned
If the creature's HD is up to your caster level – 5, it is confused and stunned.
If the creature's HD is up to your caster level – 10, it is killed, confused, and stunned.
[LONGSTART]The effects are cumulative and concurrent. A successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} reduces or eliminates these effects. Creatures affected by multiple effects make only one save and apply the result to all of the effects.[LONGEND] Creatures whose {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Dice{/g} are equal to or exceed your caster level are unaffected by word of chaos.
853a8a51-1d9e-43ce-852a-455693f60b7d:
Any nonevil creature within the area of a blasphemy {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} suffers the following ill effects:
If the creature's HD is equal to your {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}, it is dazed.
If the creature's HD is up to your caster level – 1, it is weakened and dazed.
If the creature's HD is up to your caster level – 5, it is paralyzed, weakened, and dazed.
If the creature's HD is up to your caster level – 10, it is killed, paralyzed, weakened, and dazed.
The effects are cumulative and concurrent. A successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} reduces or eliminates these effects. Creatures affected by multiple effects make only one save and apply the result to all of the effects. Creatures whose {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Dice{/g} exceed your caster level are unaffected by blasphemy.
281cac0c-9356-4a80-8f0e-fe445131eddf:
Any nongood creature within the area of a holy word {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} suffers the following ill effects:
If the creature's HD is up to your {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} – 1, it is blinded.
If the creature's HD is up to your caster level – 5, it is paralyzed and blinded.
If the creature's HD is up to your caster level – 10, it is killed, paralyzed, and blinded.
[LONGSTART]The effects are cumulative and concurrent. A successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} reduces or eliminates these effects. Creatures affected by multiple effects make only one save and apply the result to all of the effects.[LONGEND] Creatures whose {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Dice{/g} are equal to or exceed your caster level are unaffected by holy word.
ecd2952f-0c43-4f74-9617-632185bc6696:
Any nonlawful creature within the area of a dictum {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} suffers the following ill effects:
If the creature's HD is up to your {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} – 1, it is staggered.
If the creature's HD is up to your caster level – 5, it is paralyzed and staggered.
If the creature's HD is up to your caster level – 10, it is killed, paralyzed, and staggered.
The effects are cumulative and concurrent. A successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} reduces or eliminates these effects. Creatures affected by multiple effects make only one save and apply the result to all of the effects. Creatures whose {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Dice{/g} are equal to or exceed your caster level are unaffected by dictum.
865d8384-811d-4ca5-a5a1-78a59649092d:
Azata champions developed this {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} to deal with fiends with unknown resistances. A ray of spiraling colors springs from your hand and streaks to its target.
You must make a successful ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g} to hit your target with the ray, which deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}acid damage{/g}, 2d6 points of cold {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}, 2d6 points of electricity damage, and 2d6 points of fire damage.
The type of energy that does the most damage to the target then persists, dealing another 4d6 points of that {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Type}damage type{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} for 1d4 rounds.
ff22f05a-d730-4171-9354-45d9ba1f24db:
Breath Weapon: 30-foot cone of cold.
Resistance: cold 20.
1db62b76-0541-4fc5-956e-781689ea9051:
Breath Weapon: 30-foot cone of fire.
Resistance: fire 20.
ef0da1a9-0fea-4b26-8a4f-afb9c54f6fa2: Circle of death snuffs out the life force of living creatures. The {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} slays {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} HD worth of living creatures per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum 20d4). Those who are closest to the burst's point of origin are affected first. All creatures with 9 or less HD are slain outright, while creatures with more than 9 HD take 100 {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} instead. HD that are not sufficient to affect a creature are wasted.
db5e50fd-4564-40d7-861a-6e2af7ebe57b: Creatures moving through acid fog move at half their normal {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} and take a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} and melee {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} and also have a +8 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} against normal {g|Encyclopedia:RangedAttack}ranged attacks{/g}. Each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}, the fog deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}acid damage{/g} to each creature and object within it.
3146f3b2-7d48-4abf-9b9f-5ba5e15520db: Deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}4d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}acid damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} for 1d4 rounds.
1be4d5f6-3dd4-429a-8632-59b882664792: Deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}4d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}cold damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} for 1d4 rounds.
ef3d0b8b-9202-4a5f-ab4c-cb6d412a0af8: Deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}4d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}electricity damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} for 1d4 rounds.
80f40474-aff2-4e6c-9ce8-32636b81b8e3: Deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}4d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} for 1d4 rounds.
dda493de-43fe-4882-9e1b-6b390f8eafa8:
Each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}, you can target a single living creature, striking it with waves of power. The target must make a successful Fortitude saving throw, or suffer the spell's harmful effects. Depending on the target's HD, this {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} has as many as three effects:
If the target's HD is 10 or more, it is sickened for 10 minutes per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}.
If the target's HD is 5–9, it is frightened and sickened for 10 minutes per caster level.
If the target's HD is 4 or less, it is paralyzed, frightened, and sickened
The effects are cumulative and concurrent for 10 minutes per caster level.
You must spend a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} each round after the first to target a foe.
9a5fc9e5-e414-4b06-ad76-a7d75bb894de:
Harm charges a subject with negative energy that deals 10 points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (to a maximum of 150 points at 15th level). If the creature makes a successful Will {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g}, harm deals half this amount.
If used on an undead creature, harm acts like {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g}.
374df5f6-9e8c-4780-b3b1-8391416fcb21:
Negative energy spreads out in all directions from the point of origin, dealing {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d8{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} + 1 point per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum +30) to nearby living enemies.
Like other inflict {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}, it cures undead in its area rather than damaging them. A cleric capable of spontaneously casting inflict spells can also spontaneously cast mass inflict spells.
0ce0be30-c8c2-4f26-a1a1-f445517bdf0d: Summon Monster VI (1d3 Bralani Azatas or Redcaps)
e383a1c6-6435-45da-b4a2-f5f0e8b23eed: Summon Monster VI (Axiomite or Soul Eater)
59e6eec8-3d15-4ce1-bec5-68dcfb9fa6b0: Summon Nature's Ally VI (1d4+1 Dire Boars)
7b3e1218-30fe-4bdd-b048-ae6ba758dd69: The creature's Strength score is decreased.
88242d1d-b6ac-4fd7-9982-61f751bc43e1: This character has the ability to see all things as they actually are. They see through normal and magical darkness, notice secret doors hidden by magic, see the exact locations of creatures or objects under blur or displacement effects, see invisible creatures or objects normally, see through illusions, and see the true form of polymorphed, changed, or transmuted things.
1f4f02c6-cf9c-4ad8-a1db-5b955a18ba75: This creature believes that its skin is rotting away, large rents are appearing all over its body, and its internal organs are spilling out into a putrid half-liquid mass at its feet. Each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} after that, it receives a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} to disbelieve the effect, and if it fails it also must succeed at a Fortitude save or faint, falling asleep as per sleep. Waking up doesn't end the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} for a target; it must continue to attempt Will saves to disbelieve and Fortitude saves to avoid fainting each round until the spell ends or the target successfully disbelieves.
c2909db3-ad90-4595-abe9-fe0e9d3837dd: This creature can take no {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}actions{/g} until it cleans itself of the tar.
44f87e0e-89ab-4672-b5a0-5bdd400ede75:
This creature is a ravening monster — savage, bloodthirsty, and brutish. Until the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} ends, it has all of the following benefits and drawbacks:
Its {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} scores drop to 1, and it is unable to cast spells.
It takes a –4 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on Will {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g}.
It gains a +6 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, a +2 natural armor bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d8{/g} temporary {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g}. These temporary hit points disappear at the end of the spell's duration.
When the spell ends, on the next {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} this creature must succeed at a Will saving throw or take 1d4 points of Intelligence drain and 1d4 points of Charisma {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}.
3ab213dc-9c19-47c5-8417-70627f50b4aa: This creature is confused. It can make a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will saving throw{/g} against the confused effect ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}) next {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} after receiving the effect and every round after that. If the target fails the save, it continues to be confused. If it makes the save, the effect ends.
5a464b72-cdbb-4fee-aa8d-87f9343d4c4e: This creature is sleeping. A sleeping creature is {g|Encyclopedia:Helpless}helpless{/g} and treated as having a {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} of 0 (–5 modifier). {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}Melee attacks{/g} against a helpless target get a +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} (equivalent to {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacking{/g} a prone target). {g|Encyclopedia:RangedAttack}Ranged attacks{/g} get no special bonus against helpless targets. Rogues can sneak attack helpless targets. Sleeping creatures wake up after being wounded.
ec28403b-2c88-4ca1-8702-b5b9f9aee317: This creature is stuck in a hot tar and tries to escape.
ee92485c-23d8-42f1-beff-4ab9e5d4f561:
This functions as a targeted dispel magic, but it can dispel one {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} for every four caster levels you possess, starting with the highest level spells and proceeding to lower level spells.
Dispel Magic (Target): You can use dispel magic to end one ongoing spell that has been cast on a creature.
You make one dispel {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d20{/g} + your {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}) and compare that to the spell with highest caster level ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} = 11 + the spell's caster level). If successful, that spell ends. If not, compare the same result to the spell with the next highest caster level. Repeat this process until you have dispelled one spell affecting the target, or you have failed to dispel every spell.
5f7be89f-d141-4996-8114-e078e9a19528:
This functions as dispel magic, except that it affects everything within a 20-foot-radius burst or it can dispel multiple {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}, starting with the highest level spells and proceeding to lower level spells.
Dispel Magic: You can use dispel magic to end one ongoing spell that has been cast on a creature or one area effect from a spell in the selected point.
5bfd4561-f383-445b-840e-c10c603fcc1d:
This functions as dispel magic, except that it affects everything within a 20-foot-radius burst.
Dispel Magic: You can use dispel magic to end one ongoing {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} that has been cast on a creature or one area effect from a spell in the selected point.
You make one dispel {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d20{/g} + your {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}) and compare that to the spell with highest caster level ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} = 11 + the spell's caster level). If successful, that spell ends. If not, compare the same result to the spell with the next highest caster level. Repeat this process until you have dispelled one spell affecting the target or one area effect in the selected point, or you have failed to dispel every spell.
1ab26ba0-e5da-472a-8f31-536ecee975e3: This litany is a sermon of madness. The target is confused. It can make a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will saving throw{/g} against the confused effect ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}) next {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} after receiving the effect and every round after that. If the target fails the save, it continues to be confused. If it makes the save, the effect ends.
972d2dc4-caaa-48b5-9488-26ad8d11d44d:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} creates an electrical discharge that begins as a single stroke commencing from your fingertips. [LONGSTART]Unlike lightning bolt, chain lightning strikes one object or creature initially, then arcs to other targets.[LONGEND]
The bolt deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}electricity damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum 20d6) to the primary target. After it strikes, lightning can arc to a number of secondary targets equal to your caster level (maximum 20). The secondary bolts each strike one target and deal as much {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} as the primary bolt.
Each target can attempt a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex saving throw{/g} for half damage. Secondary targets must be within 30 feet of the primary target, and no target can be struck more than once.
34cc5e9f-a336-485e-a608-5d08c3874bab:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions as fester, except that it affects multiple foes.
Fester: Necrotic energy permeates the target, blocking {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}healing{/g} abilities. The subject gains {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g} equal to 12 + your {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} against effects that restore {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} or grant temporary hit points. If the target succeeds on a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude saving throw{/g}, fester lasts only a single {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}.
92867f56-4da4-43bf-b5e4-0a48bf2d0a96:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions like bear's endurance, except that it affects all allies in a 30-foot radius of the caster.
Bear's Endurance: The affected creature gains greater vitality and stamina. The spell grants the subject a +4 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}, which adds the usual benefits to {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g}, Fortitude {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g}, Constitution {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g}, and so forth.[LONGSTART] Hit points gained by a temporary increase in Constitution score are not temporary hit points. They go away when the subject's Constitution drops back to normal. They are not lost first as temporary hit points are.[LONGEND]
e480f724-0396-4fc5-9f54-782d1f6931b7:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions like bull's {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}strength{/g}, except that it affects all allies in a 30-foot radius of the caster.
Bull's Strength: The subject becomes stronger. The spell grants a +4 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to Strength, adding the usual benefits to {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}rolls{/g}, melee {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}, and other uses of the Strength modifier.[LONGSTART] Enhancement bonuses do not stack with other enhancement bonuses, for example with bonuses from belts.[LONGEND]
859f1c5c-d417-4194-bac3-079f43c54eeb:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions like cat's grace, except that it affects all allies in a 30-foot radius of the caster.
Cat's Grace: The transmuted creature becomes more graceful, agile, and coordinated. The spell grants a +4 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}, adding the usual benefits to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, Reflex {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g}, and other uses of the Dexterity modifier.[LONGSTART] Enhancement bonuses do not stack with other enhancement bonuses, for example with bonuses from belts.[LONGEND]
1864260e-784b-452b-92f5-04c12a1a08da:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions like eagle's splendor, except that it affects all allies in a 30-foot radius of the caster.
Eagle's Splendor: The transmuted creature becomes more poised, articulate, and personally forceful. The spell grants a +4 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g}, adding the usual benefits to Charisma-based {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g} and other uses of the Charisma modifier.[LONGSTART] Bards, paladins, and sorcerers (and other spellcasters who rely on Charisma) affected by this spell do not gain any additional bonus spells for the increased Charisma, but the {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}save{/g} DCs for spells they cast while under this spell's effect do increase.[LONGEND]
7b6a601e-5afc-4c2c-8c95-1c3d91af93ef:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions like fox's cunning, except that it affects all allies in a 30-foot radius of the caster.
Fox's Cunning: The target becomes smarter. The spell grants a +4 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g}, adding the usual benefits to Intelligence-based {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g} and other uses of the Intelligence modifier.[LONGSTART] Wizards (and other spellcasters who rely on Intelligence) affected by this spell do not gain any additional bonus spells for the increased Intelligence, but the {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}save{/g} DCs for spells they cast while under this spell's effect do increase. This spell doesn't grant extra skill ranks.[LONGEND]
74ae97a5-c976-4635-b378-7c34c2fb5efe: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions like heroism, except the creature gains a +4 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g}, immunity to fear effects, and temporary {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} equal to your {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum 20).
12625c69-35ac-4063-b0ff-b9e89f0c6e7d:
This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} functions like owl's {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}wisdom{/g}, except that it affects all allies in a 30-foot radius of the caster.
Owl's Wisdom: The transmuted creature becomes wiser. You become a fighting machine – stronger, tougher, faster, and more {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skilled{/g} in combat. Your mindset changes so that you relish combat and you can't cast {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}, even from magic items.
You gain a +4 enhancement {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}, a +4 form natural armor bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, a +5 competence bonus on Fortitude {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saves{/g}, and proficiency with all simple and {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}martial weapons{/g}. Your {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g} equals your {g|Encyclopedia:Character_Level}character level{/g} (but not higher than 20), which may give you multiple {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}.
f5fc9046-8c55-4437-89f5-a4598e22feea:
You become a large smilodon. You gain a +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to your {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to your {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}, and a +4 form natural armor bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}. Your movement {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} is increased by 10 feet. You also gain two {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} claw {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}, one 1d8 bite attack, and the pounce ability.
Pounce: When a smilodon makes a charge, it can make a full attack.
1e8c63da-3bf7-4d07-8f30-2e7b42834c71:
You become a large water elemental. You gain a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to your {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to your {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g}, a +6 size bonus to your {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}, a +6 form natural armor bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resist{/g} cold 20, and {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Vulnerability}vulnerability{/g} to fire. You also gain two {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d8{/g} slam {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} and the freeze ability. You are immune to {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hits{/g} and sneak attacks while in elemental form. Your movement {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} is reduced by 10 feet.
Freeze: A water elemental deals 1d8 {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}cold damage{/g} in addition to {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} dealt on a successful hit in melee. Those affected by the freeze ability must also succeed at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} or start freezing, taking 1d8 damage each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} for an additional 1d4 rounds. Creatures that hit a freezing creature with {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural weapons{/g} or {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed attacks{/g} take cold damage as though hit by the freezing creature and must succeed at a Reflex save to avoid freezing.
bc673837-1d65-4efa-a684-a0a0603d5adf: You become a {g|Encyclopedia:Size}medium{/g} dragon-like creature. You gain a +4 polymorph {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g}, a +2 polymorph bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g}, a +4 natural armor bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, immunity to difficult terrain, a breath weapon, and resistance to one element. Your movement {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} is increased by 10 feet. You also gain one bite ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d8{/g}), two claws (1d6), and two wing {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} (1d4). Your breath weapon and resistance depend on the type of your dragon prototype. You can only use the breath weapon once per casting of this {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}. All breath weapons deal 6d8 points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} and allow a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} for half damage.
0616a16b-32bd-49a6-856c-ded2eeb60658:
You can {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} a creature, harm an undead creature, or call upon a very recently dead creature to fight beyond {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}death{/g}'s reach. The target creature regains {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d8{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} per 2 {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster levels{/g} (maximum 10d8).
This healing can even bring back to life party members that have died within 2 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g}. If you cast this {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} at a creature whose hit point total is at a negative amount less than its {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} score, it comes back to life and stabilizes at its new hit point total. If you awaken a dead creature in this way, all allies within 60 feet who can see it regain consciousness gain a +2 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} for 1 minute thereafter, as the healing powers of your deity have imbued them with renewed vigor.
Creatures killed by death effects cannot be revived this way. This spell deals damage to undead creatures rather than curing them, and it cannot bring them back to life.
40de11c2-6e65-464a-ba8a-a2475b1b11cf: You channel positive energy to {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}cure{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}2d8{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} + 1 point per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum +30) on each creature in the radius. Like other cure {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}, mass cure moderate wounds deals damage to undead in its area rather than curing them. An undead creature can apply {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g}, and can attempt a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} to take half damage.
bde0efa3-7640-45e9-ac6e-504ca3c031da: You confer on the subject the ability to see all things as they actually are. The subject sees the exact locations of creatures or objects under blur or displacement effects, sees invisible creatures normally.
8b5db8cc-36a0-451a-a9e0-40218a8ec1d5: You convert a layer of the ground into hot tar. Creatures in the area when the tar appears take {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}fire damage{/g} per two {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster levels{/g} (maximum of 10d6) and must succeed at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} or become entangled until they make a successful Reflex saving throw, {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g}, or {g|Encyclopedia:Mobility}Mobility check{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} = {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} saving throw DC). They can make attempts each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} after receiving the effect. The area is difficult terrain and all creatures inside the area take a –5 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on Mobility {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g}. All creatures inside the tar area take 2d6 points of fire {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} each round and must reattempt a Reflex save or become entangled. A creature that falls prone in the area takes a –4 penalty on its Reflex save against the tar and on Strength and Mobility checks to escape the tar. After leaving the tar area, a creature can take no {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}actions{/g} for 1 round as it cleans itself from the tar.

You create a bolt of dark energy and use it to make a ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g} that ignores {g|Encyclopedia:Concealment}concealment{/g} (but not total concealment).
If you hit, the target takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum 20d6). Half of this damage is {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}cold damage{/g} and half of it is negative energy. The bolt's shadow expands and covers the target, rendering them blind for the duration of the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}. A successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} halves the damage and negates the blind condition.
99982cd9-c3f3-42ca-88f0-be3b5da4874c: You create a cone of spectral energy resembling screaming elven ghosts that deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} (maximum 15d4); a successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Reflex save{/g} halves this damage. You create a hideous gray cloud, similar to fog cloud, that occasionally crackles with foul-smelling bolts of sickly green lightning. Creatures in the area must make a Fortitude {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}save{/g} or contract one of the following diseases: blinding sickness, bubonic plague, cackle fever, mindfire, or shakes (the disease is chosen by you when you cast the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} and applies to all creatures that fail the save). The victim also takes a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on saving throws against diseases.

3c61840c-ca12-4cf7-b4f8-7308abb8d64e:
You implant within the minds of your targets the illusion that their skin is rotting away, large rents are appearing all over their bodies, and their internal organs are spilling out into a putrid half-liquid mass at their feet. Those who fail to disbelieve phantasmal putrefaction immediately take {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}. This damage occurs only once.
Each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} after that, an affected target receives another {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} to disbelieve the effect, and targets that fail must succeed at a Fortitude save or faint, falling asleep as per sleep (except that it isn't a magical sleep effect). Waking up doesn't end the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} for a target; it must continue to attempt Will saves to disbelieve and Fortitude saves to avoid fainting each round until the spell ends or the target successfully disbelieves.
b3a7d9e7-8197-4889-9cad-7782274a3c1a: You open a link between your mind and the subject's mind, giving advice and encouragement for as long as the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} is in effect. Each time the subject of the spell makes an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack roll{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability check{/g}, or {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill check{/g}, it {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}rolls{/g} two d20s and takes the better result. If any roll is a natural 20, the spell's effect ends — your brilliant advice is spent.

f5ef4d9a-e0b5-437e-92e1-5efd59c6d866: Your presence inspires incredible awe in those nearby. A creature that fails a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}save{/g} against this {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} falls to the ground and prostrates itself before you, believing it bows before a divine presence. These creatures are cowering for the duration of the spell. Each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} after that, a target of this spell may attempt a new saving throw to end the effect. A creature that recovers from this spell early after being affected by it takes {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} drain and is staggered for 1d4 rounds. A creature that succeeds at the initial save to {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}resist this spell{/g} is merely staggered for 1 round.
482fff6e-067f-47d6-b251-fcd1c9fed9a7:
{g|Encyclopedia:Healing}Heal{/g} enables you to channel positive energy into a creature to wipe away {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}injury{/g} and afflictions. It immediately ends any and all of the following adverse conditions affecting the target: {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}ability damage{/g}, blinded, confused, dazed, dazzled, diseased, exhausted, fatigued, nauseated, poisoned, sickened, and stunned. It also cures 10 {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} per level of the caster, to a maximum of 150 points at 15th level.
Heal does not remove negative levels or restore permanently drained {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability score{/g} points.
If used against an undead creature, heal instead acts like harm.
